p: The monitoring program at Toolik includes measurements on streams, lakes, and tundra (TableÂ 2). In this article, we include results of permafrost temperatures, vegetation growth, thaw depth, and lake alkalinity (Cherry et al. 2014; Shaver et al. 2014; Kling et al. 2014), extend the air temperature data, and add long-term satellite measures of plant biomass. The monitoring program of tundra and lakes at Zackenberg includes climate, the thickness of the active layer, plant community abundance, and productivity, and trends in terrestrial and freshwater ecosystem components.
